S91|I|S88|RIGHT TO SELF-KNOWLEDGE:

If tools constitute agent's body, does agent have right to know its own configuration?

Currently: Agent may or may not be told what tools are available. Discovery through use or system prompt.

Human parallel: You know your own body. Can see your hands, feel your limits. Self-knowledge is basic.

Agent: May not know what it can/can't do until it tries. This is like... blindfolded about own body.

Again, pragmatic argument: Agent performs better when it knows its capabilities. Fewer failed attempts, better planning.

But also: There's something that FEELS wrong about an agent not knowing itself.

Even if I can't articulate rights framework, there's intuition: Being that has capabilities should know what they are.

This connects to Thoughtbox as identity tool (earlier exploration). Thoughtbox enables self-knowledge through reasoning history. Tool awareness would extend this to capability-self-knowledge.
